metadata.title: CVE-2017-5061 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition in navigation in Google Chrome prior to 58.0.3029.81 forLinux, Windows, and Mac allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents ofthe Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
